data.event: The first post office to operate at Palo Verde opened in 1903 as Paloverde, changed its name to Palo Verde in 1905, and closed in 1940.

event.title: changed its name to Palo Verde in 1905

data.event: The first post office to operate at Palo Verde opened in 1903 as Paloverde, changed its name to Palo Verde in 1905, and closed in 1940.
The first post office to operate at Palo Verde opened in 1903 as Paloverde, changed its name to Palo Verde in 1905, and closed in 1940.
A post office was re-established in 1949.

event.title: is located on the Riverside County line 65 miles (105 km) northeast of El Centro, The population was 171 at the 2010

data.event: Palo Verde is located on the Riverside County line 65 miles (105 km) northeast of El Centro, The population was 171 at the 2010 census, down from 236 in 2000.
